section.title: QuickStart
section.para: If you are just keen on getting the extension running and don't care much on why it (-hopefully-) works, this is for you.

step.title: Download and install the extension extensible_sitemap

note.para: If you are new to TYPO3 and don't know how to install an extension, the Web-Empowered Church has a nice tutorial on how to install a TYPO3 extension.

step.title: Include the template Auto Configuration (extensible_sitemap) to the rootpage of your website

note.para: In TYPO3 4.4 this page is marked by a globe in the pagetree.

step.title: View the sitemap
step.para: Well, actually this is all it takes. Have a look at http://example.org/index.php?eID=extensible_sitemap to see the sitemap for your website. If you have tt_news installed you can view a news sitemap at http://example.org/index.php?eID=extensible_sitemap&sitemap=news.

note.para: Don't panik if you have tt_news configured, but just get an empty <urlset>-Tag. Only news from the last 7 days are displayed by default. This is because Google only indexes news if they are not older than 2 days. So displaying older records seems useless. You can configure this value though.

section.title: Configuration
section.para: All configuration of the extension is done via TypoScript inside plugin.tx_extensiblesitemap.

row.entry: This is the configuration for the default sitemap that will be displayed if you call http://example.org/index.php?eID=extensible_sitemap.
Additional sitemaps that might be called by visiting http://example.org/index.php?eID=extensible_sitemap​&sitemap=[sitemap]

You can define a list of multiple generators here that might return records for your sitemap. Each of them can be defined by a configuration array. The configuration options depend on the generator - so have a look at the corresponding documentation.
